title: Amazing Bond locations you HAVE to visit if you're a 007 fan
text:
Casino Royale The Grandhotel Pupp in the Czech Republic: The Hotel Splendide featured in Daniel Craig's first film Casino Royale is not actually in Montenegro. Filming took place at the Grandhotel Pupp in the town of Karlovy Vary in the Czech Republic. This hotel has been open since 1711 and also been used as a filming location for La Vie en Rose with Marion Cotillard and Shanghai Knights with Jackie Chan. Albany House, New Providence Island, Bahamas After a high-speed car chase through Miami airport, Bond travels to the Bahamas to track down villain Alex Dimitrios and ends up seducing his bored wife at his mansion. The lavish pad is actually called Albany House and is part owned by golfer Tiger Woods. It lies on the southwest coast of New Providence. Villa del Balbianello, Lake Como, Italy. 
After being tortured by super villain by Le Chiffre, Bond recuperates in the gardens of Villa del Balbianello, a villa built in 1787 on the site of a monastery for a Cardinal. The villa now belongs to the National Trust of Italy and can be visited by the public. getty The city of Panama by night Palazzo Michael, Venice, Italy 
Towards the end of the film, Bond finds himself in a gunfight in a building undergoing renovations, leading to the collapse of the whole building into the surrounding water. The Palazzo Michael, in Venice, was used for the exterior shots and remained completely in tact. Quantam of Solace Northwestern shore of Lake Garda & City of Siena, Italy. After losing the agents we cut to Bond driving into Siena, where the audience see the famous bareback horserace, the Palio de Siena, which takes place twice a year (2 nd July and 16 th August) outside the Piazza del Campo in Siena. The film starts with a nerve-wracking car chase, as Bond is pursued by agents of Quantum along the eastern shore of Lake Garda, passing through the town of Malcesine, along Via Gardesana and Navene. Andean Grand Hotel, La Paz, Bolivia aka Instituto Nacional de Cultura, Panama City, Panama Bond travels to Bolivia, where a General is plotting to overthrow the government. But funnily enough, no actual footage from Bolivia was used. Filming actually took place in either Panama or Chile. Bond checks into the Andean Grand Hotel, which doesn't exist in real life. It was the National Institute of Culture in Panama City that was transformed into a hotel for the film. GETTY This stunning desert in Chile was a scene out of a 007 movie Atacama Desert, Chile Bond crash lands in the Bolivian desert. However, the scenes were actually shot in the Atacama Desert in Chile. It's the driest non-Polar place on Earth, with some parts receiving no rainfall for up to four years. There are some salt lakes though and occasional rainfall results in incredible displays of flowering cacti. Dominic Greene’s Desert Bolthole aka The Paranal Observatory, Antofagasta, Chile The finale of the film takes place in an eco-hotel in the middle of the desert. The building used for filming is the Paranal, one of three observatories of the European Southern Observatory in the Atacama Desert. Guided tours of this are available but booking in advance is strongly recommended. 
Skyfall Istanbul, Turkey The 2012 film Skyfall opens with Bond chasing an agent through the streets of Istanbul. The action moves through Eminonu Square, near Galata Bridge, and then into the Grand Bazaar, one of the largest and oldest markets of the world. GETTY The beautiful Siena is the scene for several Bond movies 10 Trinity Square, London M is called to meet Gareth Malone at London landmark 10 Trinity Square. The building was previously the offices of insurance company Willis Faber but is currently being converted into a 5 * hotel, private residence and members club. The National Gallery, Trafalgar Square, London The scenes in Skyfall were shot in Room 34 of London’s National Gallery, which is where the painting ( The Fighting Temeraire by JMW Turner) hangs. It’s free entry for visitors and is home to some of the world’s most famous art. Hashima Island, Japan Most of the filming for the mysterious island acquired by Silva is in Skyfall is shot at Pinewood studios in London but the long shots of the landscape were shot at Hashima Island in Japan. The island was most recently declared a UNESCO world heritage site and you can catch boat tours from Nagasaki Port to see it. Buachaille Etive Mor and Buachaille Etive Beag, Glencoe, Scotland Bond and M flee from Silva and drive towards Scotland, where they come across some of the most breathtaking highland scenery. The two peaks of Buachaille Etive Mor and Buachaille Etive Beag are located in the west highlands, around 80 miles north of Glasgow. They’ve also appeared in Highlander and Braveheart.
